com.hush.pgp.io
Class PgpMessageOutputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.OutputStream
      com.hush.pgp.io.PgpMessageOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
PgpConstants, java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
public class PgpMessageOutputStream
extends java.io.OutputStream
implements PgpConstants

A PgpMessageOutputStream creates a PGP message as described in RFC 2440 10.2.

addOnePassSigner

public void addOnePassSigner(Key signer)
                      throws UnrecoverableKeyException
Adds a one-pass signer to the message. This means that the signature is created as data is written to the stream. This method must be called before any data is written to the stream.

Parameters:
signer - the signer of the message.
Throws:
UnrecoverableKeyException

addRecipient

public void addRecipient(Key recipient)
Adds a public key to which the message will be encrypted. This method must be called before any data is written to the stream.

If the key is a main key, the first encryption key or subkey wil be used.

Algorithms to be used will be chosen based on what is acceptable to all user IDs attached to the key.

Parameters:
recipient - the key to which the message will be encrypted

addRecipient

public void addRecipient(Keyring recipient)
                  throws InvalidSignatureException,
                         MissingSelfSignatureException
Throws:
InvalidSignatureException
MissingSelfSignatureException

addRecipient

public void addRecipient(Key recipient,
                         java.lang.String userID,
                         boolean useWildcardKeyID)
Adds a public key to which the message will be encrypted. This method must be called before any data is written to the stream. If the key is a main key, the first encryption key or subkey will be used.

Parameters:
recipient - the key to which the message will be encrypted.
userID - choose preferred algorithms based on this userID; if null, choose algorithms acceptable to any user ID
useWildcardKeyID - if true, the key ID for the recipient will not be specified, making the message more anonymous

setPlaintext

public void setPlaintext(boolean plaintext)
If the plaintext flag is set to true, the message can be sent without any passwords or recipients. This prevents a message from accidentally being broadcasted unencrypted.

Parameters:
plaintext - set to true to create a plaintext message.

                        int s2kType,

                        int iterationCount)

setHeaders

public void setHeaders(java.util.Hashtable headers)
Sets the headers to place in the armor if the stream is armored. This will override any headers that have already been set.

Parameters:
headers -

setCompressionAlgorithm

public void setCompressionAlgorithm(int compressionAlgorithm)
Sets the compression algorithm to use. This will be overridden by if any recipients have been added, and so is relevant only for password encrypted messages.

Parameters:
compressionAlgorithm - the compression algorithm

setCompressionLevel

public void setCompressionLevel(int compressionLevel)
Sets the compression level for zip and zlib compression.

Parameters:
compressionLevel - the compression level

setFilename

public void setFilename(byte[] filename)
Sets the filename to use in the literal data packet.

Parameters:
filename - the filename to use

setLength

public void setLength(long length)
If the length of the data to be written is known, use this method to set it and avoid using partial length packets. Will result in shorter output.

Parameters:
length - the length of the data to be written

setUseMdc

public void setUseMdc(boolean useMdc)
Set to true to use modification detection. Defaults to false.

Parameters:
useMdc - set to true to use modification detection

setSymmetricCipher

public void setSymmetricCipher(int i)
Sets the symmetric encryption algorithm to use. This will be overridden by if any recipients with preferred symmetric ciphers have been added, and so is relevant only for password encrypted messages.

setNoLiteral

public void setNoLiteral(boolean noLiteral)
Set to true to write the data directly to the compression and encryption streams without wrapping it in a literal data packet. This is false by default.

Parameters:
noLiteral -

setText

public void setText(boolean isText)
Set to true if you want there to be a flag in the literal data packet indicating that the data is text. This defaults to false

Parameters:
isText - the data is text

setUseArmor

public void setUseArmor(boolean useArmor)
Set to true if you want to ASCII armor the message. Defaults to false.

Parameters:
useArmor - true to use ASCII armor

setTimestamp

public void setTimestamp(long timestamp)
Sets the timestamp of the message in seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC.

Parameters:
timestamp - the timestamp

public void setSignatureHashAlgorithm(int signatureHashAlgorithm)
